# GetOutputSafetyOffset

**Instance Method**

Returns the output safety offset of the device.

## Declaration

```swift
uint32_t GetOutputSafetyOffset();
```

## Return Value

The output safety offset value, as a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/kernel/uint32_t].

## Discussion

The safety offset indicates the number for frames ahead of the current hardware position that’s safe to perform output I/O.

## Working with Safety Offset Behvaior

- **SetInputSafetyOffset**: Specifies the input safety offset of the device.
- **GetInputSafetyOffset**: Returns the input safety offset of the device.
- **SetOutputSafetyOffset**: Specifies the output safety offset of the device.
